summary: Dok čekamo Cyberpunk 2077, tu je Cyberslav!
title: Dok čekamo Cyberpunk 2077, tu je Cyberslav!
body:
Dok čekamo Cyberpunk 2077, tu je Cyberslav!

Do izlaska jedne od najočekivanijih igara današnjice, Cyberpunk 2077, ćemo se još uvek načekati bar do 2020. godine, ako ne i više, no po onome što smo do sada videli, vredi čekati.

Ipak, jedan drugi sajberpank projekat koji nam takođe dolazi sa slovenskih podneblja nam je ovih dana skrenuo pažnju. Radi se o animiranom filmu Киберслав/Cyberslav, na kome radi Evil Pirate studio iz Sankt…

View On WordPress

Ipak, jedan drugi sajberpank projekat koji nam takođe dolazi sa slovenskih podneblja nam je ovih dana skrenuo pažnju. Radi se o animiranom filmu Киберслав/Cyberslav, na kome radi Evil Pirate studio iz Sankt…

blog.name: thefalloutscrolls
blog.title: [scroll down]
blog.description:
Whatever crosses my mind in relation to computer games; mostly screenshots. I'm also playing around with a stitching program so expect some screenshot panoramas (they're tagged #panorama).
I'm aiming for a high original content ratio. Y'know, as original as screenshots of games that I had no part in making can be ;)
Fallout 3, New Vegas, and Skyrim dominate the blog so far. I'm planning to play a bunch of other games shortly though, so expect some Witcher, Bioshock, Deus Ex, Dishonored, or some such.
Like what you like, reblog what you want, feel free to ask me anything on and off topic, you know the drill. (Feel entirely free to remove my comments when reblogging, btw.)
Have fun!

summary: Unsurprisingly, V’s name is “missing data”, to be entered by the player. His/her date of birth is listed as 2054 though, which...
caption:
Unsurprisingly, V’s name is “missing data”, to be entered by the player.

His/her date of birth is listed as 2054 though, which would make V a mere 23 years old in 2077. I smell a good story about how he/she teamed up with grizzled old street veteran Jackie - particularly since Jackie is clearly a Night City resident whereas V is new to the sprawl.

The backstory menu features submenus for Childhood Hero, Key Life Event, and Why Night City? It’s not clear what impact these choices will have, but I’m hoping for something more than alternative dialogue lines. The voiceover does seem promising though … (”What you choose here will unlock different possibilities later on.”)

While the choices are sufficiently vague to allow for roleplaying, it’s clear that our character is a street kid. Key Life Events do not include “not getting second cyberpony for birthday”.

I also wonder whether Education and Prior Convictions, left blank for now, will actually serve a function or just exist for aesthetic purposes. Perhaps I’m reading too much into this, but given that V just moved to Night City, this may be a new and incomplete data set. (On the lower right, it says Night City Recognition Program - perhaps suggesting an automated data gathering protocol.)

summary: The character creation menu takes the form of a database entry of some sort. Which sort of begs the question - what organization...
caption:
The character creation menu takes the form of a database entry of some sort. Which sort of begs the question - what organization deems it necessary to maintain a database of nude 3d models of all the (according to the first screen) 12.396,608 inhabitants of Night City?

It must be a bitch to keep up to date too, given the existence of biomods … also, I shudder to think what some of the more extreme implantees look like under the hood. Just saying.

Anywho, the character creation menu seems more limited than, say, Fallout 4, which is honestly fine by me as long as the range of options is diverse enough.

summary: two things I know for sure about my Cyberpunk 2077 character. Her name is Valeria Cortez. And I’m going to focus most of her...
body:
two things I know for sure about my Cyberpunk 2077 character.

Her name is Valeria Cortez.

And I’m going to focus most of her points in Cool and Tech and optimise away from combat.

((im going to cybernetically augment my V to the point where you cant technically even call them human))
summary: “Cyberpunk 2020's 'cyberpsychosis' mechanic, in which players who overly augment themselves with cyberware start to see a...
body:
“Cyberpunk 2020’s ‘cyberpsychosis’ mechanic, in which players who overly augment themselves with cyberware start to see a negative effect on their mental health, will form part of the game – though CD Projekt won’t go into details. As a quest designer, the Faustian bargain behind transhumanism is fascinating to Patrick Mills. “All the travails of the flesh fade away, and you become a perfect machine of chrome. But you had to buy those body parts from someone, and now you’re in debt to them; if you need parts, you’ve got to go to their store. You have this very utopian idea of being liberated by technology. And it’s like, not so fast – you haven’t solved the problems. The problems are still there, and technology actually makes them worse. 'High tech, low life’ is one of Mike’s mottos.”

-EGDE Magazine’s article on Cyberpunk 2077

reblog.comment:

tags: tbh i love nightclubs in video games
the thumpy bassy songs and just the whole atmosphere
don't think i'd ever wanna go to one irl though xD
lol i'd love to see someone doing the flail-your-arms dance from vtmb
also the shepard shuffle from the ME trilogy
summary: oh man i hope there are nightclubs in Night City like in Vampire The Masquerade Bloodlines where you could just go hang out, get...
body:
oh man i hope there are nightclubs in Night City like in Vampire The Masquerade Bloodlines where you could just go hang out, get a drink, break loose on the dance floor, enjoy the music, meet people for shady deals…

could even cut to third person to let us enjoy seeing V break it down

(and before you point it out, yeah I know that we’ll be going to “Afterlife” in the Dexter Deshawn quest but i just mean in general free roam without quest flags)

tags: unless they will sleep during the cutscenes and stuff???
summary:
If Cyberpunk 2077 is going to have a full day and night cycle,
Does this mean we will have to make sure V gets enough rest? Or...
body:
If Cyberpunk 2077 is going to have a full day and night cycle,

Does this mean we will have to make sure V gets enough rest? Or will they just be another protagonist who has no need for sleep?

I think it will be interesting to see how this works out.

reblog.comment:

so if u have any suggestions on what to look into next send me an ask or w/e
i also sont know if this is common knowledge but i hope this is of use to someone
also tell me if i got something wrong
summary: (This is based on Cyberpunk 2020, the tabletop RPG that CP2077 is based off of. Some of this may be wrong when the game comes...
body:
what the CP2077 stats mean, according to CP2020

(This is based on Cyberpunk 2020, the tabletop RPG that CP2077 is based off of. Some of this may be wrong when the game comes out. But I hope this helps those (like me) who are already creating ocs for this game)

Strength and Constitution: In CP2020, both fall under the ‘Body Type’ stat. This stat determines how much damage you deal and take, how far you can throw, and how you recover from shock. How much you can carry is determined by multiplying your carry weight by 10.

Intelligence: This stat deals with your problem solving abilities, as well as noticing and remembering things. I think this stat will be heavily modified to suit Cyberpunk 2077.

Reflexes: Reflexes are important to characters who do a lot of fighting (probably why it’s so high here). Also helps with driving, athletics, etc. I think the Movement Allowance stat (how fast you can run) will be merged into reflexes.

Tech(nical Ability): Your skill with technology. How well you can use and repair technology, especially unfamiliar tech.

Cool: Your character’s pain resistance. How well they react (and fight) under stress and pressure. Basically, how well they can keep their cool under certain situations.

In the Demo, they mentioned Street Cred and it being influenced by your clothing and reputation. This is similar to CP2020′s Attractiveness stat (how good-looking you are).

When buying cybernetics, a ‘Humanity cost’ is shown. In CP2020, Humanity falls under Empathy. Empathy being how well you relate to others, basically charisma. Humanity is directly related to cybernetics (the more cybernetics you get, the less human you become). In CP2077, Humanity most likely will be how other people react to you. A high humanity (or vice versa) may open up certain dialogues or quest endings.

The only CP2020 stat that doesn’t seem to be in the game is Luck. But this stat affected dice rolls and such so I can see why it would be left out.
